title: Sri Lanka schedules power cuts up to 3.5 hours for April 09, 10
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Power cuts of up to 3.5 hours have been approved in Sri Lanka for April 09 and April 10, Public Utilities Commission Chairman Janaka Ratnayake said as severe foreign exchange shortages to import fuel were temporarily eased with fuel on borrowed money from India.
On April 09 areas A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V and W will have power cuts of 2 hours from 3pm to 10pm.
Area CC1 will have a power cut of 3.5 hours from 6am to 9.30am.
On April 10, areas A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V and W will have power cuts of one hour from 6pm to 10pm.

“We hope electricity consumption will be reduced in the [Sinhala and Tamil] New Year week, due to the holidays. However, a final decision has not been taken yet regarding the power shedding situation,” Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) spokesman Andrew Navamani told EconomyNext on Friday (08).
“Our plants still do not have adequate fuel supply to run fully,” he added.
Navamani said 7,000 MT Diesel is scheduled to be transferred to KPS around 10pm Friday.
Sri Lanka’s electricity demand has risen amid power cuts with more people using electricity for cooking and a delay in raising prices. (Colombo/Apr08/2022)
